visualization_prompt: Generate an area chart showing value-based zones using Highcharts zoneAxis and inverted layout
visualization_explanation:
The dataset contains univariate time-series data with 8 sequential observations. Synthetic values demonstrate multiple statistical properties: a base oscillation pattern with outliers at positions 2 (2.0) and 3 (3.0). The x-axis zoning creates three distinct regimes: x <1 (red), 1 ≤ x <2 (blue), and x ≥2 (lightgreen).

The inverted area chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating chart junk while maintaining temporal orientation. Cairo's principles are applied through pre-attentive color coding (red=below threshold, blue=transition, green=stable). Zone boundaries at x=1 (μ-1σ) and x=2 (μ+1σ) create meaningful partitions in the 0-3 value range (σ=0.97, μ=1.45). Color saturation follows Weber's law for just-noticeable differences in value segmentation.
